docs.snippet: The Republic of Uruguay was added yesterday to the list of South American nations unable to keep up sinking-fund payments on their external debts, retiring substantial amounts of bonds yearly. Jose Richling, Charge d'Affaires of the Uruguayan...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Republic of Uruguay was added yesterday to the list of South American nations unable to keep up sinking-fund payments on their external debts, retiring substantial amounts of bonds yearly. Jose Richling, Charge d'Affaires of the Uruguayan Government, issued a statement here notifying American bondholders of the inability of the government to continue the sinking funds in 1932 without depleting its gold reserves but that the interest on the bonds would continue to be paid.
docs.abstract: Defaults sinking-fund payments on external debts; says payment of interest will continue

headline.main: URUGUAY DEFAULTS ON SINKING FUNDS; Halts Retirement of Bonds, but Says Payment of Interest Will Continue. CITES CURRENCY DECLINE Government Announces Step Is Necessary to Safeguard Its Gold Reserves.

docs.snippet: United States Government bonds formed the strongest group in the bond market on the Stock Exchange yesterday, all three issues of Treasury 3 3/8s, and the 3 1/8s and the 3s, making new highs for the year. Net gains in the government list ranged from...
docs.lead_paragraph: United States Government bonds formed the strongest group in the bond market on the Stock Exchange yesterday, all three issues of Treasury 3 3/8s, and the 3 1/8s and the 3s, making new highs for the year. Net gains in the government list ranged from 2-32 to 14-32 point.
docs.abstract: Distribution of funds to bondholders planned

headline.main: FEDERAL BONDS UP ON STOCK EXCHANGE; Advances Range From 2-32 to 4-32, With Five Issues Making New Highs for the Year. OTHER SECTIONS DECLINE Foreign Loans and the Domestic Corporation Group Ease in Moderate Trading.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Feb. 17 -- Andre Tardieu, with his colleagues, Paul Reynaud and Colonel Jean Fabry, left for Paris this evening. Although the disarmament conference will continue, even the momentary absence of France has taken from it much of its zest.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Feb. 17 -- Andre Tardieu, with his colleagues, Paul Reynaud and Colonel Jean Fabry, left for Paris this evening. Although the disarmament conference will continue, even the momentary absence of France has taken from it much of its zest.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 10 -- The provisional government is studying the proposed draft for a new general treaty of friendship, commerce and navigation with Uruguay, which was drawn up by the delegates to the bilateral section of the recent economic...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 10 -- The provisional government is studying the proposed draft for a new general treaty of friendship, commerce and navigation with Uruguay, which was drawn up by the delegates to the bilateral section of the recent economic conference at Montevideo which was attended by delegates of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay.

headline.main: BRAZIL AND URUGUDAY STUDY NEW TREATY; Montevideo Conference Urged One With Most-Favored-Nation Clause. LIMITED FREE TRADE ALSO Agreement Would Set Up Four Joint Boards to Regulate Particular Points.

byline.original: Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON. WHAT is believed to be the largest collection of toy soldiers in existence -- certainly one of the moat comprehensive -- was formed during the later years of his life by an English physician, Dr. Vere Nicoll, who died recently.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON. WHAT is believed to be the largest collection of toy soldiers in existence -- certainly one of the moat comprehensive -- was formed during the later years of his life by an English physician, Dr. Vere Nicoll, who died recently.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22. -- Espousal by the British Government of a new program of protection and imperial preference may have an adverse effect upon farm exports to the United Kingdom, the most important foreign market for American agricultural surplus,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22. -- Espousal by the British Government of a new program of protection and imperial preference may have an adverse effect upon farm exports to the United Kingdom, the most important foreign market for American agricultural surplus, officials of the Department of Agriculture said today in a study of the outlook for foreign competition and demand.
docs.abstract: U S Agr Dept warns of extension of quota system to Dominions

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 24 -- Substitution by the Scantic Line of the Schenectady and Chickasaw for the Minnequa and City of Fairbury for reconditioning and remodeling under the construction loan agreement of Feb. 16 was authorized by the Shipping Board today.
